definition: to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: She ties a very confused Rachel up with more and more rope keeping her handcuffs on her.
sentences.chinese: 她联系很困惑，瑞秋和越来越多的绳子把她铐在她。

sentences.english: I have seen the freest among you wear their freedom as a yoke and a handcuff.
sentences.chinese: 我曾看见你们之中最自由者，把自由像枷铐似的戴上。

sentences.english: Try this equalizing cuff that can be tied without using the ends of the rope.
sentences.chinese: 试试这种均衡铐，不需要绳端就可以系。

sentences.english: The criminal's ankles were shackled with chains to prevent his escape.
sentences.chinese: 这名犯人被铐上了脚链以防他逃跑。

sentences.english: As soon as I zipped up, he put handcuffs on me, Theisen said.
sentences.chinese: 当我拉上裤链的时候，他就把我铐住了。

sentences.english: Let him put handcuffs on the dead and beat them senseless with whips.
sentences.chinese: 让他铐上死人的手吧，鞭打他们无知觉的尸体吧。

sentences.english: Heavy iron chains around his feet and hands were fixed to a metal bar that ran round the hall about ten centimetres off the ground.
sentences.chinese: 铐着他的脚和手的沉重的镣铐被固定在一条铁栏杆上。

sentences.english: At the time, Al-Ani's hands were cuffed behind his back.
sentences.chinese: 而当时，阿尔安尼的双手还被铐在背后。

sentences.english: Both died very brutally, the captain with both hands handcuffed together, and two bullet holes in his abdomen.
sentences.chinese: 死的都很惨，船长双手被手铐铐住，腹部有两个枪眼。

sentences.english: The police officer seized the suspect by the arms and cuffed him.
sentences.chinese: 那名警察抓住嫌犯的手臂，并把他铐上手铐。

sentences.english: The officers hand-cuffed Zhou behind his back on the first day of his arrest.
sentences.chinese: 他第一天被捕时，公安人员就用手铐铐住他。

sentences.english: Krantz is cuffed to the banister and left behind.
sentences.chinese: “将军”被铐在栏杆上，留在了房间里。

sentences.english: Officer to handcuff a prisoner to his right hand?
sentences.chinese: 自己的右手和他递解的囚犯铐在一起的？

sentences.english: Lincoln painfully drops to his knees and the police restrain him.
sentences.chinese: Lincoln痛苦地跪倒在地，警员铐住了他。

sentences.english: After some discussion, I was handcuffed.
sentences.chinese: 在一些讨论之后，我被铐上了。

definition: to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
to beat/to flog/to examine under torture
to detain/to take into custody/to imprison temporarily
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
